lru-type.name: DGCK
lru-type.description: A description of the performance requirements for timing and delay is given in Notes on Delay Tracking for ALMA: Resolutions and Tolerance, L. DAddario 2003-Febuary-02. This memo describes how adjusting the sampler phase is part of an overall delay that is introduced to align the sampled data from different antennas. Additional, coarser delay, is done in the correlator. Adjusting the sampler phase allows control of the delays at the intervals of less than one sample. The coordination and partitioning of the delays, between the DTS Digitizer Clock and the correlator is done, in the ACC, by the control software. The important part of the performance specifications are that the sampler clocks need to be adjusted at most once every 10.8 milliseconds, that the phase needs to be controlled in steps no coarser than 1/8 of a sample clock period and that there is no significant degradation if phase is updated on millisecond boundaries.

assembly-type.name: DGCK
assembly-type.description: A description of the performance requirements for timing and delay is given in Notes on Delay Tracking for ALMA: Resolutions and Tolerance, L. DAddario 2003-Febuary-02. This memo describes how adjusting the sampler phase is part of an overall delay that is introduced to align the sampled data from different antennas. Additional, coarser delay, is done in the correlator. Adjusting the sampler phase allows control of the delays at the intervals of less than one sample. The coordination and partitioning of the delays, between the DTS Digitizer Clock and the correlator is done, in the ACC, by the control software. The important part of the performance specifications are that the sampler clocks need to be adjusted at most once every 10.8 milliseconds, that the phase needs to be controlled in steps no coarser than 1/8 of a sample clock period and that there is no significant degradation if phase is updated on millisecond boundaries.

baci-property.description: This monitor point will instruct the DTS Digitizer clock firmware to return the contents of the data in the last PHASE_COMMAND sent to it. If no PHASE_COMMAND has ever been sent then this command will return all zeros. If there has been some timing events were no phase command has been sent then the value returned by this command will correspond to the HASE_COMMAND sent in an earlier interval. It is expected that this command will only be used for debugging.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point will instruct the DTS Digitizer clock firmware to return the contents of the data in the last PHASE_COMMAND sent to it. It is expected that this command will only be used for debugging.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point will instruct the DTS Digitizer clock firmware to return the contents of the data in the last PHASE_COMMAND sent to it. If no PHASE_COMMAND has ever been sent then this command will return all zeros. If there has been some timing events were no phase command has been sent then the value returned by this command will correspond to the HASE_COMMAND sent in an earlier interval. It is expected that this command will only be used for debugging.

baci-property.description: This command returns the phase of the Digitizer clock through the previous timing interval. Normally it will return the same data as the LAST_PHASE_COMMAND but if no PHASE_COMMAND was received in the preceding timing interval it will return data where the first byte is on, the time of the first change is zero and the phase of this change represents the current phase of the Digitizer clock.

monitor-point.description: This command returns the phase of the Digitizer clock through the previous timing interval. Normally it will return the same data as the LAST_PHASE_COMMAND but if no PHASE_COMMAND was received in the preceding timing interval it will return data where the first byte is on, the time of the first change is zero and the phase of this change represents the current phase of the Digitizer clock.

baci-property.description: Bit 0 lets the software know if the phase locked loop has been unlocked since last readout. This monitor point voltage is latched so that if the loop goes out of lock for a short period of time, before returning to lock, this monitor point will remain set. Reset throught the RESET_PLL_FLAG_command.

monitor-point.description: Bit 0 lets the software know if the phase locked loop has been unlocked since last readout. This monitor point voltage is latched so that if the loop goes out of lock for a short period of time, before returning to lock, this monitor point will remain set. Reset throught the RESET_PLL_FLAG_command.

baci-property.description: This monitor point indicates if the Digitizer clock hardware has not received a PHASE_COMMAND for every 48ms timing interval since the last MISSED_COMMAND_RESET command was sent.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point indicates if the Digitizer clock hardware has not received a PHASE_COMMAND for every 48ms timing interval since the last MISSED_COMMAND_RESET command was sent.

baci-property.description: This monitor point reads the delay between the antenna TE and the internal TE. The end effect is a delay of the phase shifts. Delay is returned at seconds.

monitor-point.description: This monitor point reads the delay between the antenna TE and the internal TE. The end effect is a delay of the phase shifts. Delay is returned at seconds.
